documents.title: SNAP Benefits Application Guide
documents.summary: How to apply for SNAP (food stamps) benefits in New York State.
documents.content:
SNAP (SUPPLEMENTAL NUTRITION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM):

HOW TO APPLY:

1. ONLINE (Recommended):
   - Visit myBenefits.ny.gov
   - Create an account
   - Complete the application
   - Upload required documents
   - Schedule interview (phone or in-person)

2. IN PERSON:
   - Visit your local Department of Social Services
   - Complete paper application
   - Bring required documents

3. BY PHONE:
   - Call OTDA Hotline: 1-800-342-3009
   - TTY: 1-800-421-1220

REQUIRED DOCUMENTS:
- Proof of identity (ID, driver license)
- Proof of citizenship or immigration status
- Proof of NY residency
- Social Security numbers for all household members
- Proof of income (pay stubs, tax returns)
- Proof of resources (bank statements)
- Proof of expenses (rent, utilities, childcare)

PROCESSING TIME:
- Standard: 30 days
- Expedited (if eligible): 7 days

documents.title: SNAP Eligibility Requirements
documents.summary: Income and eligibility requirements for SNAP benefits.
documents.content:
SNAP ELIGIBILITY:

INCOME LIMITS (2026):
Gross Monthly Income (130% of poverty):
- 1 person: $1,659
- 2 people: $2,237
- 3 people: $2,815
- 4 people: $3,393
- Each additional: +$578

Net Monthly Income (100% of poverty):
- 1 person: $1,276
- 2 people: $1,721
- 3 people: $2,166
- 4 people: $2,611
- Each additional: +$445

RESOURCE LIMITS:
- General households: $2,750
- Households with elderly/disabled: $4,250
- Vehicles, home, and retirement accounts usually exempt

WHO CAN APPLY:
- Must be NY State resident
- US citizen or qualified non-citizen
- Must meet income guidelines
- Must register for work (unless exempt)

MAXIMUM MONTHLY BENEFITS (2026):
- 1 person: $291
- 2 people: $535
- 3 people: $766
- 4 people: $973

Note: Actual benefit depends on income and expenses.

documents.title: HEAP - Home Energy Assistance
documents.summary: Home Energy Assistance Program to help pay heating costs.
documents.content:
HEAP (HOME ENERGY ASSISTANCE PROGRAM):

WHAT IS HEAP?
HEAP helps low-income New Yorkers pay for:
- Heating bills
- Cooling assistance (summer)
- Furnace repairs/replacement
- Weatherization

HOW TO APPLY:
1. Visit myBenefits.ny.gov
2. Contact local DSS office
3. Call HEAP Hotline: 1-800-342-3009

ELIGIBILITY (2025-2026 Season):
Income Limits (60% of State Median Income):
- 1 person: $2,729/month
- 2 people: $3,569/month
- 3 people: $4,409/month
- 4 people: $5,249/month

BENEFIT AMOUNTS:
- Regular benefit: $400-$1,000 (varies by fuel type)
- Emergency benefit: Up to $750 additional
- Heating equipment: Up to $6,000 for repair/replacement

IMPORTANT DATES:
- Regular HEAP: Opens November 1
- Emergency HEAP: Opens January 2
- Cooling assistance: Opens May 1

AUTO-ENROLLMENT:
If you receive SNAP, SSI, or TANF, you may automatically receive HEAP.

documents.title: Medicaid Application
documents.summary: How to apply for Medicaid health coverage in New York.
documents.content:
MEDICAID IN NEW YORK:

WHAT IS MEDICAID?
Medicaid provides free or low-cost health coverage for:
- Low-income adults
- Children
- Pregnant women
- Elderly
- People with disabilities

HOW TO APPLY:
1. NY State of Health (nystateofhealth.ny.gov)
2. Local Department of Social Services
3. Phone: 1-855-355-5777

ELIGIBILITY INCOME LIMITS (2026):
(Based on Modified Adjusted Gross Income)
- Single adult: Up to $20,121/year (138% FPL)
- Family of 2: Up to $27,214/year
- Family of 4: Up to $41,400/year
- Pregnant women: Up to 223% FPL
- Children: Up to 405% FPL

COVERED SERVICES:
- Doctor visits
- Hospital care
- Prescriptions
- Mental health
- Dental (limited)
- Vision (limited)
- Transportation to appointments

NOTE: This is general guidance only. Actual eligibility is determined by the NY State of Health marketplace during the application process.

DISCLAIMER: Eligibility depends on many factors. This information does not guarantee benefits.
